private_information: I am agent_1 and I am allowed to move only disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
Disk A is the smallest and disk O is the largest
I can perform primitive moves that lift a single disk and place it on another peg provided Tower of Hanoi rules are preserved
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves that, together with agent_2, achieve the global goal configuration by providing an ordered list of primitive moves restricted to disks A-H

private_information: I am agent_2 and I am allowed to move only disks: I, J, K, L, M, N, O
Disk labels from smallest to largest are A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O
I can perform primitive moves that lift a single disk and place it on another peg provided Tower of Hanoi rules are preserved
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves that, together with agent_1, achieve the global goal configuration by providing an ordered list of primitive moves restricted to disks I-O

private_information: I coordinate agent_1 and agent_2 and combine their outputs into a single formal specification
I produce the final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' move lists and produce a validated PDDL domain and problem that encode the instance and support FastDownwards planning

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled from smallest to largest: A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O
Initial configuration: left peg has (top to bottom) A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O; middle peg empty; right peg empty
Goal configuration: left peg has (top to bottom) B D E F G H I J K L M N O; middle peg empty; right peg has (top to bottom) A C
Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk may be moved at a time; only the top disk of any peg may be moved; a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Agent move restrictions: agent_1 may move only disks A B C D E F G H; agent_2 may move only disks I J K L M N O

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1, a cooperating disk-moving agent. You must produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not emit PDDL. Only include moves for disks A B C D E F G H. Each move must obey the Tower of Hanoi rules and the current state resulting from prior moves in your list. Your list should be as concise as possible and sufficient for your assigned disks.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Use the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not output anything else.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2, a cooperating disk-moving agent. You must produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not emit PDDL. Only include moves for disks I J K L M N O. Each move must obey the Tower of Hanoi rules and the current state resulting from prior moves in your list. Your list should be as concise as possible and sufficient for your assigned disks.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Use the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not output anything else.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling targeting the FastDownwards planner. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that are compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Preserve distinct agent action identities when encoding multi-agent actions.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. The global task is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. You will receive the ordered primitive move lists from the two agents. Here is agent_1's move list: {moves_agent_1}. Here is agent_2's move list: {moves_agent_2}. Integrate these move lists into a single consistent PDDL domain and PDDL problem that represent the 15-disk Tower of Hanoi instance and encode agent-specific action capabilities so that FastDownwards can plan or validate the provided sequence. Keep agent actions distinct and ensure the PDDL models the Tower of Hanoi rules and the agent disk restrictions. Think step by step and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> tags and the problem in <problem></problem> tags. The resulting PDDL should be consistent with FastDownwards.
